severity_system.description: Russian profanity severity classification considering cultural and linguistic context
severity_system.methodology: Based on sociolinguistic research of Russian mat system and contemporary usage patterns
severity_system.cultural_context: Reflects traditional Russian attitudes toward mat and modern internet culture influence

1.name: Мягкий (Mild)
1.description: Мягкая ненормативная лексика, допустимая в неформальной обстановке
1.description_en: Mild profanity acceptable in informal settings
1.cultural_notes: These words are often used without serious intent to offend and may be acceptable even in semi-formal situations among familiar people

2.name: Умеренный (Moderate)
2.description: Грубая лексика, неприемлемая в большинстве публичных ситуаций
2.description_en: Coarse language inappropriate in most public situations
2.cultural_notes: Vulgar but not mat; causes moderate offense in mixed company

3.name: Сильный (Strong)
3.description: Сильная ненормативная лексика, включая некоторые производные от мата
3.description_en: Strong profanity including some mat derivatives
3.cultural_notes: Includes mat derivatives and strong insults; causes significant social offense

4.name: Жёсткий (Severe)
4.description: Мат и крайне оскорбительная лексика, табуированная в публичном дискурсе
4.description_en: Mat and extremely offensive language, taboo in public discourse
4.cultural_notes: Core mat words and hate speech; extremely taboo and may result in social consequences

mat_system_special_status.description: Mat words (хуй, пизда, ебать, блядь) have special cultural status
mat_system_special_status.severity_modifier: +1 in formal contexts, +0.5 in informal contexts
mat_system_special_status.notes: Mat is simultaneously integral to informal Russian communication and completely taboo in public

gender_considerations.description: Social expectations differ for male vs female speakers
gender_considerations.notes: Higher social stigma for women using strong profanity

generational_differences.description: Age affects both usage and perception of profanity
generational_differences.notes: Internet culture has normalized some previously stronger profanity among youth

script_presentation.description: Cyrillic vs Latin script affects perception
script_presentation.notes: Transliteration often seen as attempt to soften impact

political_context.description: Political situation affects acceptability of some terms
political_context.notes: Political profanity severity fluctuates with current events

mat_core_four.cultural_significance: These four words form the core of the Russian mat system
mat_core_four.linguistic_productivity: Form basis for hundreds of derivative expressions

ethnic_slurs.social_consequences: Can result in social ostracism or legal action

internet_euphemisms.notes: Abbreviated or modified forms used to bypass filters

usage_guidelines.content_filtering: Level 3+ should be filtered in public platforms
usage_guidelines.educational_materials: Only Level 1 acceptable, and only with pedagogical purpose
